post_text: Attention Greene County Households! We need everyone to respond to the census to help our county with funding for our roads, our schools, our health department and all our government services. The US Census just announced that they will resume some of their field operations which will include census workers delivering paper questionnaire to households that normally pick up their mail at post office boxes. This includes 2,331 households in Greene County. This will be a contactless process following all the health social distancing guidelines. They will simply place a bag on the door handles without knocking or talking to residents. Please respond immediately after you receive your survey, this is VERY IMPORTANT for our county! You can respond by mail, by phone at (844) 330-2020 or by the internet at 2020census.gov. Please encourage your friends and family to respond today by sharing this post.

We need YOUR help in Greene County! The response rate for Greene County is currently 50.1% of households responding, this is compared to the Illinois average rate of 65.3%. The funding we receive for government services for schools, highways, law enforcement, EMTs, hospitals and senior citizen services and much more is dependent on the census count. Please complete your 2020 Census TODAY, it only takes about 10 minutes online at https://2020census.gov You may also respond by phone at 844-330-2020. Please contact your friends and family and share this post on all your social media platforms.

Take the 2020 Census | U.S. Census Bureau

Carrollton School District #1 Board Member Vacancy

The Carrollton School District is accepting applications to fill the vacancy resulting from a resignation from the Board of Education. The appointment will be from the date of appointment until the next regular school board election which will be held in April 2017.

Applicants for the School Board vacancy must be: a US citizen; at least 18 years of age; a resident of Illinois and the District for at least one year immediately preceding the appointment; and a registered voter. The applicant cannot be: a child sex offender; hold another incompatible public office; have a prohibited interest in any contract with the District; hold certain types of prohibited State of federal employment.

Applications may be obtained at the District office located at 950A Third Street, Carrollton beginning on July 21, 2016. Completed applications must be turned in by 1:00 Monday, August 1, 2016 to Gina Settles, Secretary Board of Education at the District office.
